'''Swinub''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ウリムー''' ''Urimoo'') is a dual-type {{2t|Ice|Ground}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Piloswine}} starting at [[level]] 33, which evolves into {{p|Mamoswine}} when [[level]]ed up while knowing {{m|Ancient Power}}.

==Biology==
Living in frigid temperatures, Swinub is covered in dense, brown, striped hair to keep it warm. The hair is so shaggy that it often covers its tuft-like small legs, making it appear like a legless lump. Swinub’s eyes appear as if they are perpetually closed. Swinub uses its pink, pig-like nose to dig through mud and snow, looking for anything edible. Occasionally, it will come across hot springs while scouring the ground. Its favorite food is a type of mushroom that grows beneath dead grass, though it also eats Berries. When a Swinub finds an attractive smell, it will run desperately to find out the source of the aroma. It inhabits cold places, such as {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Cave Pokémon|icy caves}}, mountainous regions and frozen tundra.

==In the anime==
[[File:Dawn Swinub.png|thumb|210px|left|Swinub in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:Swinub Egg.png|thumb|100px|right|A Swinub {{pkmn|Egg}} in the anime]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Dawn's Swinub]]====
{{an|Dawn}} captured a {{TP|Dawn|Swinub}} in ''[[DP084|Hungry for the Good Life!]]''. It evolved into {{p|Piloswine}} in ''[[DP104|Sleepless in Pre-Battle!]]'', and then into {{p|Mamoswine}} in ''[[DP106|A Breed Stampede!]]''.

====Other====
Swinub debuted in ''[[EP188|Spring Fever]]''. There were three named "Sue", "Ein", and "Ub", and they were used by [[Peggy]] and [[Rory|her father]] to sniff out places to dig for hot springs.

In ''[[AG188|Pinch Healing]]'', a Swinub was being babysat by a Poké-Sitter named {{OBP|Matt|AG188}}. At the [[Pokémon Center]], {{an|May}} was playing with it.

Three Swinub were featured in ''[[DP063|Hot Springing a Leak!]]''; they were owned by [[Leona]], one of {{an|Dawn}}'s childhood friends.

===Minor appearances===
Two Swinub were among the Pokémon resting in some hot springs in ''[[EP259|Entei at Your Own Risk]]''.

A Swinub was used by one of the students of the [[Pokémon Trainers' School]] in ''[[AG015|Gonna Rule The School!]]''.

A Swinub appeared in ''[[AG158|Queen of the Serpentine!]]'' as one of {{FB|Pike Queen|Lucy}}'s pets.

A Swinub appeared as one of the Pokémon owned by [[Nurse Joy]] in [[EP250]] and in ''[[DP028|Drifloon on the Wind!]]''.

A Swinub was seen as part of [[Lila]]'s famous "tiger lily smile" in ''[[DP095|Battling the Generation Gap!]]''.

A Swinub appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

A Swinub appeared in a flashback or a fantasy in ''[[XY035|The Forest Champion!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Swinub appeared in ''[[XY084|Adventures in Running Errands!]]''.

A Swinub appeared in ''[[XY108|A Watershed Moment!]]'' in a flashback.

A Trainer's Swinub appeared in ''[[XY125|A League of His Own!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Pryce Swinub Adventures.png|thumb|130px|Swinub in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Swinub is seen as one of the Pokémon under [[Pryce]], and is often kept on his lap when he rides his wheelchair (and during battle). When Pryce becomes lost in time, the Swinub is trapped with him. The same Swinub returned along with Pryce at [[Sinjoh Ruins]], and it fought alongside with him against Dialga. It first appeared in ''[[PS144|Savvy Swinub]]''.

In ''[[PS387|Striking Out Snover]]'', wild Swinub are shown near [[Snowpoint City]], some of them being cared by [[Candice]].

===In the Pocket Monsters Diamond & Pearl manga===
A Swinub appeared in [[PDP24]].

===In the Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys manga===
{{tc|Camper}} Yuki of Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys used a Swinub in a tournament in ''[[GB14|Let's Fight! The Mini Pokémon Tournament]]'' where it fought against {{GnB|Gold}}'s {{p|Elekid}} and lost.

===In the Pokémon Gotta Catch 'Em All manga===
A Swinub appeared in [[GDZ64]]. It was caught by a Trainer passing by.

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
[[Pryce]] owns a Swinub which battled {{TP|Red|Clefairy}}.

==Trivia==
[[File:Swinub eyes Adventures.png|thumb|180px|Swinub's eyes in Pokémon Adventures]]
* Swinub has the lowest base stat total of all {{type|Ice}} Pokémon. This includes the lowest base {{stat|Special Defense}} among Ice-type Pokémon.
* The only time that Swinub's eyes have been seen open was during the battle between [[Pryce]] and [[Erika]] in the {{adv|Round}} ''[[PS163|Bringing up Bellossom]]'' from [[Pokémon Adventures]] when Pryce ordered his to dodge Erika's {{p|Skiploom}}'s attack.
* Swinub is one of the few Pokémon with the same sprite in both Gold and Silver.
* Swinub is the only Pokémon that can be resistant to damage from all types of weather effects, including {{m|Shadow Sky}}, without the aid of an Ability.
* In {{2v2|HeartGold|SoulSilver}} coding, it is revealed that Swinub has {{m|Mud Shot}} listed as a "new HGSS" Egg move, but it could already learn this move by breeding since [[Generation III]].
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Swinub and its evolutions.
** Swinub and its evolutions are also the only Pokémon weak to the types of all three [[starter Pokémon]].

===Origin===
Swinub's size and appearance seem to be based on a mix of a Peruvian {{wp|guinea pig}} and a {{wp|wild pig|wild boar}} piglet. It may also be based on wordplay of the {{wp|groundhog}}. Both are similar in characteristics and behavior, while "{{t|Ground}} hog" describes Swinub's type and species quite well. Swinub also resembles the {{wp|Marsupial mole}}.

====Name origin====
Swinub is a combination of ''{{wp|swine}}'' and ''nub'' (referring to its lump-like nose).

Urimoo may be a combination of 瓜坊 ''uribō'' (a wild boar piglet) and ブーブー ''bū bū'' (an {{wp|onomatopoeia}} for oinking).
